thread.title: Renoir, Degas works on display at Currier Museum
thread.title_full: Renoir, Degas works on display at Currier Museum - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: wcax.com
title: Renoir, Degas works on display at Currier Museum
text:
MANCHESTER, N.H. (AP) - Two impressionist paintings by Renoir and Degas are on currently on loan to the Currier Museum of Art.
Pierre-Auguste Renoir's "Les Premier Pas" ("The First Step") from 1876 has not been seen in public since 1914. It shows a mother helping her child take its first steps.
Edgar Degas' "La Répétition au Foyer de la Danse" ("The Dance Rehearsal at Home") from about 1882 features one of his favorite subjects: ballet dancers.
Both works are now on view at the Currier's European Gallery, through the holidays.
